reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park Hotel is an elegant hotel within a 15-20 minute walk of the centre of Split.
reviews.title: An elegant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel staff to very helpful. The rooms are not large, but they were very functional. Our room looked out to sea. We caught the sea breezes, but also the street noises of some very happy drunks as they staggered home.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The terrace of the hotel is a great place to relax - large very comfortable chairs and hotel staff just so eager to assist.
reviews.title: such a lovelly place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at both breakfast and at dinner was wonderful. We obtained some excellent restaurant recommendations from the hotel - at both ends of the price spectrum.
reviews.title: Decent, clean hotel near beach and historic Split
Old hotel and overpriced
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed aweek at the park ,we found it just the place to chill out. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel was clean,and the rooms were fine,we will definately use it on our next visit to this lovely city
The last time we stayed at the Park Hotel was in the 90s. Unfriendly staff, in need of repair, over priced. We asked to have breakfast on the terrace outside the dining room and we were told "NO!"
reviews.title: Delightful Change

reviews.text: All this has changed. Breakfast is now served on the terrace. The staff tries to help in any way requested. I needed to call a friend in Split so I asked at the front desk. The receptionist went to get a cell phone for me to use. The rooms have been redone. Quite comfortable. The Park is one of a group of small, independent hotels in Croatia. I have been pleased with my stays in other hotels in this group. The transportation center for Split is only about a 10 minute walk. The old city is maybe a 15 minute walk.
reviews.title: Hotel Park Split Croatia (Like Hotels Used To Be)

likes.liked: — well run, committed to their guests, good position, clean, good food lovely terrace

reviews.title: Comfortable and clean...slightly overpriced
reviews.text: Stayed at The Hotel Park for one week in June 2007.A most charming and well run hotel who puts it's guests in the centre of everything. The restaurant menu is superb and the breakfasts more than adequate. To have dinner and breakfast on the lovely terrace is delightful. The rooms are well designed, comfortable beds and super bathrooms.
All the staff from management , front desk, waiters, and the lovely lady who cleaned my room could not have been any more helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: So-so Experience at Hotel Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Few days ago, I stayed at this beuatifull hotel near the beach.
reviews.title: very nice place for business or pleasure!
Nice hotel let down by poor services
reviews.text: The weather was not so good but from this point of view that wasn't so important since I was sorrounded with nice people and great staff.The room was facing the sea, not so big but very nice furnished, clean and well equiped.The service was excellent, great ladies at the front desk who called me on the phone the day earlier just to confirm their reservation and ask me how I was doing! Great service from the beginning! It is not all done by the computers, a human touch is still present in this hotel.Food in the restaurant is mediteranien cuisine, meat or fish, doesn't matter, it is great. The breakfast, lunch or dinner at the terrace is a MUST. It is one of the most beautifull terraces I have ever seen. I bet in summer time is even more prettier.I learned that the hotel exists since 1920's and has very long tradition. It is elegant and smart place, from the movies kind of hotel where everybody knows your name after only few minutes and where you can live for a while and feel like at home.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel in a beautiful location above a small attractive bay near the harbour. The hotel has a pleasant ambiance and there is a delightful terrace where it is good to relax with a drink and look over the bay. It is about a 15 minute walk to Diocletian's Palace. The hotel is clean and well furnished. The rooms at the front have nice views.

reviews.title: Classical, Traditional Comfort
reviews.text: I had a single room which was a bit small but otherwise OK. There were a number of problems however. There was no hot water on either of the nights I was there (I've never known this in a 4-star hotel). The service in the restaurant was very poor which might explain why it was almost empty even though the hotel was almost full. Tables were not cleared at breakfast which meant you had to move others' dirty plates before you could sit down.
